title: 312. Not Your Grandmother’s I.M.F.
description: The International Monetary Fund has long been the "lender of last resort" for economies in crisis. Christine Lagarde, who runs the institution, would like to prevent those crises from ever happening. She tells us her plans.
author: editor@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: The International Monetary Fund has long been the "lender of last resort" for economies in crisis. Christine Lagarde, who runs the institution, would like to prevent those crises from ever happening. She tells us her plans.
